page.title: 01Gazetteer
page.content: The area is predominantly rural. Agriculture, and particularly horticulture, account for the majority of the land use. Most people, apart from those working on the land, commute to London or the surrounding urban communities. The land undulates, and there is more woodland than in other parts of Essex. An abandoned railway line runs north to south. A derelict church lies in the valley of the River Blackwater. Gravel extraction pits and two garages constitute the main trade and industry. The main A12 London to Yarmouth road runs through the north western part of the area. Generally it is a quiet district without a focal point as it lies between two villages.
